newsitem.title: SINGAPORE: Singapore maintains 5.0-7.0 pct growth forecast.
newsitem.headline: Singapore maintains 5.0-7.0 pct growth forecast.

text.p: Singapore's Ministry of Trade and Industry said on Tuesday it was maintaining its 1997 economic growth forecast at five to seven percent.
In 1996 Singapore's gross domestic product grew 7.0 percent for the year as a whole, and 5.8 percent in the fourth quarter.
The ministry said recent indications from the electronics industry suggested improvements ahead, such as stronger demand for computers.
Companies will also benefit from moderation in cost pressures, the ministry said.
